title: Contradiction
author: VD
content_html:
“Your right to your religious belief ends when it violates the law.”
– Judge Thomas Gossett

“Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof;”
– The First Amendment

There would seem to be a certain dichotomy here. How can a religious belief violate the law, if it is not permitted for laws to prohibit the free exercise of religion?
